page.title: 07Donington-le-Heath Manor
page.content: The{Manor House}at Donington-le-Heath was built in about 1280, but little is known of its early history. It had stone walls and a slate roof on a timber frame. Later it served as a farmhouse and more recently as an outbuilding to house pigs. The house changed very little over the years, probably because the various owners could not afford alterations. In 1963 the house was marked as an {ancient monument}and in 1965 Leicestershire County Council bought and started to restore it. The building was re-roofed with Swithland slate and the plaster cladding removed to reveal the old fireplaces. Museum furniture was then installed and the House now serves as a museum, in which visitors can obtain some idea of what the Manor House was like in Medieval times.
